docblock.description: This class is the glue that binds all of the Open Web Presence functionality together.
docblock.long-description: It acts as the controller, logic, and view handler without extreme complexity of an entire MVC framework.

tag.name: method
tag.description: Establish the app environment using the Dotenv library.

tag.name: uses
tag.description: Dotenv\Dotenv Loads environment variables from .env to getenv(), $_ENV and $_SERVER automagically. This is a PHP version of the original Ruby dotenv.

tag.description: Loads the footer based on the template setting.

tag.description: Loads the template based on the template setting.

docblock.description: This class provides messaging for the owpFramework library utilizing PHPMailer.

tag.name: param
tag.description: User array used to create the user's record. ("email", "passwd", "first_name", "last_name", "statusID", "welcome_email_sent", "uuid")

tag.name: throws
tag.description: Thrown when the provided argument is not valid user data, code 20

tag.name: throws
tag.description: Thrown on standard failures, code 10, UDF failures code 30

tag.name: method
tag.description: Reset the lost pass UUID and set the statusID, for example when a lost password request has been completed

tag.name: method
tag.description: Get a user data item for the logged in user

tag.name: param
tag.description: String info as an alternative to the userDataItem when it does not exist

tag.name: param
tag.description: String info to append to the userDataItem

tag.name: method
tag.description: Get user data for the logged in user

tag.name: return
tag.description: User data array or false if it fails

tag.name: method
tag.description: Returns true if a valid user session exists

tag.name: method
tag.description: Retrieve a user's data (with meta) based on userID, without setting a session

tag.name: return
tag.description: User array or false on failure

tag.name: method
tag.description: Retrieve base user data without any meta data by userID

tag.name: method
tag.description: Get the userID via the lost UUID token, previously set by setLostPassUUID()

tag.name: param
tag.description: UUID token usually sent via email for validation

tag.name: method
tag.description: Returns true if the user is flagged as an admin

tag.name: method
tag.description: Refresh the session data from the user's record

tag.name: method
tag.description: Validate that the user session still exists, if not redirect them

tag.name: param
tag.description: (optional) URL to redirect to should the user sanity check show the user is not logged in

tag.name: method
tag.description: Log the user out, clearing the user session

tag.name: method
tag.description: Create a lost password recovery UUID token

tag.name: method
tag.description: Usually used in conjunction with getUserIDViaLostPassUUID() and setLostPassUUID() for lost passwords or to the user to updated their own passwrd

tag.name: throws
tag.description: Provided argument is now valid userID

tag.name: method
tag.description: Check if user exists via email

tag.name: method
tag.description: User login via email and password

tag.name: param
tag.description: Where statement to be using within the user row query

tag.name: method
tag.description: Retrieve a user's data based on a dynamic WHERE statement

tag.name: param
tag.description: The string WHERE statement used in tbl_users select

tag.name: return
tag.description: User array or false on failure

tag.name: method
tag.description: Retrieve base user data without any meta data by WHERE statement

tag.name: param
tag.description: The string WHERE statement used in tbl_users select

tag.name: method
tag.description: Get only the user meta data

tag.name: method
tag.description: Updating the login counter as well as the user's current IP address

tag.name: method
tag.description: Validate the passed password against the user hash supplied

tag.name: param
tag.description: User UUID token created with the record, not related to the lost password UUID
